meanings.definition: A person who studies or imitates ancient styles or methods.
meanings.sent1: The archaists at the museum carefully examined the ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The archeology students learned about the archaists who recreated ancient pottery techniques.
meanings.sent3: The archaists decided to have a themed party where everyone dressed like ancient Egyptians.
meanings.sent4: Her grandfather was an archaist in heart, always preferring the ways of the past.
meanings.sent5: The group of archaists worked tirelessly to preserve the traditional dance forms.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of the past; old-fashioned.
meanings.sent1: The archaists furniture in the antique shop caught her eye.
meanings.sent2: The village had a charming, archaists feel with its cobblestone streets and gas lamps.
meanings.sent3: She found it amusing that her brother tried to bring back archaists slang from the 1800s.
meanings.sent4: The archaists clock on the mantel seemed to tick in sync with the memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The archaists dress she wore to the party made her feel like she had stepped back in time.
